Bases: object

PipelineExecutor class for executing the generated pipelines.

execute func.

Executes the generated pipelines.

Parameters:

  • pipeline_list (list[Code]) – List of generated pipeline code

  • initial_timeout (int) –

  • output_dir (Path) – output directory to store the results

  • cancel (CancellationToken, optional) –

Returns:

candidate_scripts – It stores both the results and the code in list of tuples format.

Return type:

list[tuple[Code, RunningResult]]

sapientml.macros module

class sapientml.macros.Metric(value)

Bases: Enum

metrics used for verifying the results accuracy.

F1

F1 Score metrics

Type:

str

R2

R2 score used to evaluate the performance of a regression-based machine learning model.

Type:

str

RMSLE

Root Mean Squared Logarithmic Error (RMSLE)

Type:

str

RMSE

Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE)

Type:

str

AUC

AUC (Area Under the Curve)

Type:

str

Accuracy

Accuracy is a metric that generally describes how the model performs across all classes It is calculated as the ratio between the number of correct predictions to the total number of predictions.

Type:

str

MAE

Mean Absolute Error (MAE)

Type:

str

Gini

The Gini Coefficient is used to evaluate the performance of Binary Classifier Models. The value of the Gini Coefficient can be between 0 to 1. The higher the Gini coefficient, the better is the model.

Type:

str

LogLoss

Log loss, also known as logarithmic loss or cross-entropy loss, is a common evaluation metric for binary classification models.

Type:

str

ROC_AUC

ROC (receiver operating characteristic curve) AUC (Area Under the Curve) ROC is a probability curve and AUC represents the degree or measure of separability.

Type:

str

MCC

The Matthews correlation coefficient (MCC)

Type:

str

MAP_K

Mean Average Precision at K (MAP@K) is one of the most commonly used evaluation metrics for recommender systems and other ranking related classification tasks.

Type:

str

QWK

QWK (Quadratic weighted kappa) is useful when dealing with imbalanced datasets or when the cost of misclassification varies across classes.

Type:

str

AUC = 'auc'
Accuracy = 'accuracy'
F1 = 'f1'
Gini = 'Gini'
LogLoss = 'LogLoss'
MAE = 'MAE'
MAP_K = 'MAP_'
MCC = 'MCC'
QWK = 'QWK'
R2 = 'r2'
RMSE = 'RMSE'
RMSLE = 'RMSLE'
ROC_AUC = 'ROC_AUC'

sapientml.main module

class sapientml.main.SapientML(target_columns: list[str], task_type: Literal['classification', 'regression'] | None = None, adaptation_metric: str | None = None, split_method: Literal['random', 'time', 'group'] = 'random', split_seed: int = 17, split_train_size: float = 0.75, split_column_name: str | None = None, time_split_num: int = 5, time_split_index: int = 4, split_stratification: bool | None = None, model_type: str = 'sapientml', **kwargs)

Bases: object

fit(training_data: DataFrame | str, validation_data: DataFrame | str | None = None, test_data: DataFrame | str | None = None, save_datasets_format: Literal['csv', 'pickle'] = 'pickle', csv_encoding: Literal['UTF-8', 'SJIS'] = 'UTF-8', csv_delimiter: str = ',', ignore_columns: list[str] | None = None, output_dir: str = './outputs', codegen_only: bool = False)

Generate ML scripts for input data.

Parameters:

  • training_data (pandas.DataFrame or str) – Training dataframe. When str, this is regarded as a file path.

  • validation_data (pandas.DataFrame, str or None) – Validation dataframe. When str, this is regarded as file paths. When None, validation data is extracted from training data by split.

  • test_data (pandas.DataFrame, str, or None) – Test dataframes. When str, they are regarded as file paths. When None, test data is extracted from training data by split.

  • save_datasets_format ('csv' or 'pickle') – Data format when the input dataframes are written to files. Ignored when all inputs are specified as file path.

  • csv_encoding ('UTF-8' or 'SJIS') – Encoding method when csv files are involved. Ignored when only pickle files are involved.

  • csv_delimiter (str) – Delimiter to read csv files

  • ignore_columns (list[str]) – Column names which must not be used and must be dropped.

  • output_dir (str) – Output dir

  • codegen_only (bool) – Do not conduct fit() of GeneratedModel if True

Returns:

self – SapientML object itself

Return type:

SapientML

static from_pretrained(model)

The factory method of SapientML from a pretrained model built by source code previously generated by SapientML.

model must be either pickle filename, pickle bytes-like object, or deserialized object

Parameters:

model (str, bytes-like object, or GeneratedModel) – A pretrained model built by source code previously generated by SapientML.

Returns:

sml – a new SapientML instance loaded from the pretrained model.

Return type:

SapientML

predict(test_data: DataFrame)

Predicts the output of the test_data and store in the prediction_result.csv.

Parameters:

test_data (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe used for predicting the result.

Returns:

result – It returns the prediction_result.csv result in dataframe format.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

sapientml.model module

class sapientml.model.GeneratedModel(input_dir: PathLike, save_datasets_format: Literal['csv', 'pickle'], timeout: int, csv_encoding: Literal['UTF-8', 'SJIS'], csv_delimiter: str, params: dict)

Bases: object

fit(training_dataframe: DataFrame)

Generate ML scripts for input data.

Parameters:

training_dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – Training dataframe.

Returns:

self – GeneratedModel object itself

Return type:

GeneratedModel

params

The constructor of GeneratedModel. Instantiating this class by yourself is not intended. :param target_columns: Names of target columns :type target_columns: list[str] :param task_type: Specify classification or regression. :type task_type: ‘classification’ or ‘regression’ :param adaptation_metric: Metric for evaluation.

Classification: ‘f1’, ‘auc’, ‘ROC_AUC’, ‘accuracy’, ‘Gini’, ‘LogLoss’, ‘MCC’(Matthews correlation coefficient), ‘QWK’(Quadratic weighted kappa). Regression: ‘r2’, ‘RMSLE’, ‘RMSE’, ‘MAE’.

Parameters:

  • split_method ('random', 'time', or 'group') – Method of train-test split. ‘random’ uses random split. ‘time’ requires ‘split_column_name’. This sorts the data rows based on the column, and then splits data. ‘group’ requires ‘split_column_name’. This split the data so as not to split rows with the same value of ‘split_column_name’ into train and test data. Currently, this option is not valid in the hyperparameter tuning. Don’t set time or group when hyperparameter_tuning=True.

  • split_seed (int) – Random seed for train-test split. Ignored when split_method=’time’.

  • split_train_size (float) – The ratio of training size to input data. Ignored when split_method=’time’.

  • split_column_name (str) – Name of the column used to split. Ignored when split_method=’random’

  • time_split_num (int) – Passed to TimeSeriesSplit’s n_splits. Valid only when split_method=’time’.

  • time_split_index (int) – The index of the split from TimeSeriesSplit. Valid only when split_method=’time’.

  • split_stratification (bool) – To perform stratification in train-test split.

predict(test_dataframe: DataFrame)

Predicts the output of the test_data and store in the prediction_result.csv.

Parameters:

test_dataframe (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe used for predicting the result.

Returns:

result_df – It returns the prediction_result.csv result in dataframe format.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

save(output_dir: PathLike)

Save generated code to output_dir folder

Parameters:

output_dir (Path-like object) – Training dataframe.

Returns:

self – GeneratedModel object itself

Return type:

GeneratedModel

class sapientml.params.Task(*, target_columns: list[str], task_type: Literal['classification', 'regression'] | None, split_method: Literal['random', 'time', 'group'], split_seed: int, split_train_size: float, split_column_name: str | None, time_split_num: int, time_split_index: int, adaptation_metric: str | None, is_multiclass: bool = False, split_stratification: bool | None = None)

Bases: BaseModel

Task class.

target_columns

Names of target columns

Type:

list[str]

task_type

Specify classification or regression.

Type:

‘classification’ or ‘regression’

ignore_columns

list of columns which are not necessary or ignored.

Type:

list[str]

split_method

Method of train-test split. ‘random’ uses random split. ‘time’ requires ‘split_column_name’. This sorts the data rows based on the column, and then splits data. ‘group’ requires ‘split_column_name’. This split the data so as not to split rows with the same value of ‘split_column_name’ into train and test data. Currently, this option is not valid in the hyperparameter tuning. Don’t set time or group when hyperparameter_tuning=True.

Type:

‘random’, ‘time’, or ‘group’

split_seed

Random seed for train-test split. Ignored when split_method=’time’.

Type:

int

split_train_size

The ratio of training size to input data. Ignored when split_method=’time’.

Type:

float

split_column_name

Name of the column used to split. Ignored when split_method=’random’

Type:

str

time_split_num

Passed to TimeSeriesSplit’s n_splits. Valid only when split_method=’time’.

Type:

int

time_split_index

The index of the split from TimeSeriesSplit. Valid only when split_method=’time’.

Type:

int

adaptation_metric

Metric for evaluation. Classification: ‘f1’, ‘auc’, ‘ROC_AUC’, ‘accuracy’, ‘Gini’, ‘LogLoss’, ‘MCC’(Matthews correlation coefficient), ‘QWK’(Quadratic weighted kappa). Regression: ‘r2’, ‘RMSLE’, ‘RMSE’, ‘MAE’.

Type:

str

is_multiclass

To check whether it is a multiclass or not.

Type:

bool

split_stratification

To perform stratification in train-test split.

Type:

bool

adaptation_metric: str | None
is_multiclass: bool
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'adaptation_metric': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[str, NoneType], required=True), 'is_multiclass': FieldInfo(annotation=bool, required=False, default=False), 'split_column_name': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[str, NoneType], required=True), 'split_method': FieldInfo(annotation=Literal[str, str, str], required=True), 'split_seed': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True), 'split_stratification': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[bool, NoneType], required=False), 'split_train_size': FieldInfo(annotation=float, required=True), 'target_columns': FieldInfo(annotation=list[str], required=True), 'task_type': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[Literal[str, str], NoneType], required=True), 'time_split_index': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True), 'time_split_num': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

split_column_name: str | None
split_method: Literal['random', 'time', 'group']

split_stratification: bool | None

sapientml.params.save_file(dataframe: DataFrame, filepath: str, csv_encoding: str, csv_delimiter: str) → None

Saving dataframe to pickle or csv files

Parameters:

  • dataframe (pd.DataFrame) – The data to output

  • filepath (str) – The path of output file

  • csv_encoding ('UTF-8' or 'SJIS') – Encoding method when csv files are involved. Ignored when only pickle files are involved.

  • csv_delimiter (str) – Delimiter to read csv files

Module contents

class sapientml.SapientML(target_columns: list[str], task_type: Literal['classification', 'regression'] | None = None, adaptation_metric: str | None = None, split_method: Literal['random', 'time', 'group'] = 'random', split_seed: int = 17, split_train_size: float = 0.75, split_column_name: str | None = None, time_split_num: int = 5, time_split_index: int = 4, split_stratification: bool | None = None, model_type: str = 'sapientml', **kwargs)

Bases: object

fit(training_data: DataFrame | str, validation_data: DataFrame | str | None = None, test_data: DataFrame | str | None = None, save_datasets_format: Literal['csv', 'pickle'] = 'pickle', csv_encoding: Literal['UTF-8', 'SJIS'] = 'UTF-8', csv_delimiter: str = ',', ignore_columns: list[str] | None = None, output_dir: str = './outputs', codegen_only: bool = False)

Generate ML scripts for input data.

Parameters:

  • training_data (pandas.DataFrame or str) – Training dataframe. When str, this is regarded as a file path.

  • validation_data (pandas.DataFrame, str or None) – Validation dataframe. When str, this is regarded as file paths. When None, validation data is extracted from training data by split.

  • test_data (pandas.DataFrame, str, or None) – Test dataframes. When str, they are regarded as file paths. When None, test data is extracted from training data by split.

  • save_datasets_format ('csv' or 'pickle') – Data format when the input dataframes are written to files. Ignored when all inputs are specified as file path.

  • csv_encoding ('UTF-8' or 'SJIS') – Encoding method when csv files are involved. Ignored when only pickle files are involved.

  • csv_delimiter (str) – Delimiter to read csv files

  • ignore_columns (list[str]) – Column names which must not be used and must be dropped.

  • output_dir (str) – Output dir

  • codegen_only (bool) – Do not conduct fit() of GeneratedModel if True

Returns:

self – SapientML object itself

Return type:

SapientML

static from_pretrained(model)

The factory method of SapientML from a pretrained model built by source code previously generated by SapientML.

model must be either pickle filename, pickle bytes-like object, or deserialized object

Parameters:

model (str, bytes-like object, or GeneratedModel) – A pretrained model built by source code previously generated by SapientML.

Returns:

sml – a new SapientML instance loaded from the pretrained model.

Return type:

SapientML

predict(test_data: DataFrame)

Predicts the output of the test_data and store in the prediction_result.csv.

Parameters:

test_data (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe used for predicting the result.

Returns:

result – It returns the prediction_result.csv result in dataframe format.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
